intro: Arabis greatrexii, commonly known as the Greatrex's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, appearing in clusters at the end of the stems. Arabis greatrexii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
